title: Kym Marsh pays tribute to her 'angel baby' as she calls to end to miscarriage taboo
text:

Coronation Street's Kym Marsh has paid tribute to her baby Archie, who she lost when he was born 18 weeks premature in 2009.

The actress wrote a heartbreaking caption alongside a picture of a stone angel and a candle bearing her son's name.

It said: "Today we remember all of those babies who became angels far too soon, and all of the parents whose hearts remain broken.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: SOPA Images/LightRocket via Gett)

"I am one of those parents. I am a mummy to an angel baby and I am forever grateful to have had him in my life no matter how short a time.

"Let’s stand together, lift the taboo and break the silence of baby loss. Sending love to all ❤️❤️ #babylossawarenessday .

Kym, 43, lost Archie ten years ago while she was with her now ex husband Jamie Lomas who stars in Emmerdale .

Kym has another three children: David Ryan Cunliffe, 24, Emilie Mae Cunliffe, 22, and Polly Lomas, 8.

(Image: PA)

Her fans came together to show their appreciation for the post and some shared their own stories of suffering miscarriages.

"I’m feeling it too my baby died in April keep strong xx", said one.

"My wife lost a baby (Robert) before I met her. The pain I see her go through every anniversary is heartbreaking.

"No words can express my heart felt sympathy for any couples who have gone through the pain of losing a baby", shared a second.

(Image: Instagram)

"Huge hugs to you beautiful lady xx", added a third.

Kym recently waved goodbye to both her character Michelle Connor, who has her final days on the cobbles in weeks to come, and her army boyfriend Scott Ratcliff, who will be going away on tour again.

Kym admitted it was "always stressful" when her love has to go away with work because he is sent out to "dangerous places".

(Image: EMPICS Entertainment)

They fell madly in love with each other when her Coronation Street co-star Antony Cotton set them up last year.

The mother expressed her anxiety when she "barely spoke a word" to her army beau for two long hard months while he was stationed out in Kenya where there was no phone signal.

She said to The Sun : “There is always anxiety, it is always stressful when he goes away. There may not be an actual war threat currently but there’s always a risk when you’re in these dangerous places.

(Image: Getty Images)

“And it can be extra worrying when you aren’t able to communicate for periods of time... But it won’t be easy watching him go away, and I will worry until I see him again.”

However, Kym confessed saying goodbye to Coronation Street wasn't all bad news.

The soap star, who played Michelle for 14 years, celebrated she would be able to devote more time focusing on things she enjoys and seeing her family.
description: Kym Marsh asked her followers to help break the taboo around miscarriages in a tribute to her baby who died ten years ago
